intro: Gajanus lanceolata, commonly known as the African moonflower, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its large, fragrant, white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, round fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist woodlands or along riverbanks. Botanically, it belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants.
